info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 8:54AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A NARROW BAND OF LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT PARTS OF SOUTHERN MIDDLESEX... NORTHERN NEW HAVEN...NORTHERN MIDDLESEX...AND SOUTHERN NEW HAVEN COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A narrow band of light to moderate snow showers accompanied by winds up to 35 mph. Visibility down to one mile at times. An additional few tenths of an inch of snow is possible in this band. Motorists are advised to use extra caution this morning as untreated roads will be snow and ice covered. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 849 AM EDT, a northwest to southeast oriented band of snow showers was nearly stationary across eastern New Haven County. The band is expected to slowly weaken through 10 am. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... New Haven, Waterbury, Meriden, Middletown, Wallingford, Naugatuck, Guilford, Southbury, Wolcott, Clinton, Durham, Hamden, Cheshire, Branford and North Haven. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
